Model

Class DatabaseUtility

  • java.lang.Object
    • Model.DatabaseUtility

  • public class DatabaseUtility
extends java.lang.Object
    A utility class for retrieving the persistent data of this application. It is important to be careful when editing this class. Static "initialization" may not behave the way that you think. Make sure to include an initialization call from ServletContextListener

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Retrieves the most recent number of gymRats in the given gym.

      Retrieves a list of GymClass objects associated with gymName on dayOfWeek.

      Retrieves the maximum number of people that have ever been in the gym at a given time.

      Initialize the class information and gym hours, etc.

    • Method Detail

      • getMaxCount

        public static int getMaxCount(java.lang.String gymName)
        Retrieves the maximum number of people that have ever been in the gym at a given time.
        Parameters:
        gymName - The name of the gym to find the maximum count for.
        Returns:
        the maximum number of people that have ever been in the gym at the same time, or -1 if an error occurred.

      • getCount

        public static int getCount(java.lang.String gymName)
        Retrieves the most recent number of gymRats in the given gym.
        Parameters:
        gymName - the name of the gym
        Returns:
        the number of people currently in gymName or -1 if an error occurred.

      • getGymClassesFor

        public java.util.List<GymClass> getGymClassesFor(java.lang.String gymName,
                                                 DayOfWeek dayOfWeek)
        Retrieves a list of GymClass objects associated with gymName on dayOfWeek. This implementation reads in all GymClass data on server startup in order to decrease latency time for data retrieval.
        Parameters:
        gymName - The name of the gym to retrieve GymClasses for
        dayOfWeek - The day of the week to retrieve GymClasses for
        Returns:
        a list of all GymClass objects associated with gymName and dayOfWeek or null if an error occurs.

      • updateCount

        public static boolean updateCount(java.lang.String gymName,
                                  java.util.Date timestamp,
                                  int count)
        Updates the current count of gymName with count and saves it in the database.
        Parameters:
        gymName - The name of the gym whose count will be updated.
        timestamp - The timestamp for the sensor that recorded the count.
        count - The number of people in the gym at time timestamp.
        Returns:
        true if the database and model both updated successfully and false otherwise.

      • init

        public static void init()
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Initialize the class information and gym hours, etc. This loads all the class information into memory, at the start of the program, preventing additional disk reads which are slow and expensive.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
